Hail of Arrows' base physical damage is converted to cold. Consequently this damage scales with increases to cold damage, but not increases to physical damage. It also has a chance to freeze enemies each second.

All slow chance from this tree is converted to chill chance and effects related to slow now depend on chill instead.

Swaps Hail of Arrows' {Physical} tag for a {Cold} tag.

This has no effect if Hail of Arrows is converted to poison with {Acid Rain}.

exvol8-25.name: Frost Shots
description: Hail of Arrows has increased chance to freeze enemies each second and has increased chill duration.

exvol8-26.name: Steady
description: Hail of Arrows lasts longer.

exvol8-27.name: Nowhere to Hide
description: Hail of Arrows deals more bow damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) over its duration scaling up to a maximum. This does not affect damaging ailments.

exvol8-28.name: The Hunt
description:
Hail of Arrows lasts significantly longer (multiplicative with other modifiers), but you can only have one Hail of Arrows active at a time. 

Using Hail of Arrows again causes the old instance to stop.

exvol8-29.name: Endless Barrage
description:
Hail of Arrows is now channeled and can be retargeted while you are channelling. It costs less initial mana, but rapidly drains your mana.

Channelled Hail of Arrows' delay is halved, and increases to its delay are halved.

exvol8-30.name: Acid Rain
description:
Hail of Arrows' base physical damage is converted to poison. Consequently this damage scales with increases to poison damage, but not increases to physical damage.

Swaps Hail of Arrows' {Physical} tag for a {Poison} tag.

Bleed chance from all sources is converted to poison chance.
reminderText: {Barrage of Arrows} is not converted to poison.

exvol8-31.name: Venom Arrows
description: Hail of Arrows has a chance to poison enemies each second.

exvol8-32.name: Headshot
description: Hail of Arrows deals more bow damage to stunned enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers). This does not affect ailment damage.

falc0-1.name: Marking Strikes
stats: 20% Falcon Chance to inflict Falconer's Mark
description: Your Falcon's other hits now have a chance to inflict {Falconer's Mark}.

falc0-2.name: Falconer's Mark
description: Whenever the Falcon hits an enemy with {Falcon Strikes} it {Marks} them. Your next hit against a {Marked} target deals more damage and consumes the {Mark}.

falc0-4.name: Avian Arsenal
description:
When you consume a {Falconer's Mark} your Falcon gains additional melee damage equal to a portion of your added melee damage, throwing damage, bow damage, or spell damage depending on the type of ability used to consume the mark.

This effect lasts 10 seconds and can stack a limited number of times.
reminderText: Stronger stacks can only be replaced by weaker stacks if their remaining duration is less than 2 seconds.

falc0-5.name: Toxic Airdrop
description:
Your Falcon now throws {Acid Flasks} for you. {Acid Flasks} thrown by the Falcon scale with your stats and your {Acid Flask} tree, but can apply {Falcon's Mark} from {Marking Strikes}.

This effect consumes mana equal to a portion of your {Acid Flask's} mana cost and has a 6 second cooldown.

falc0-6.name: Flask Satchel
description: Your Falcon has additional {Acid Flask} charges.

falc0-7.name: Parrotkin
stats: 25% Chance to grant Falcon Acid Flask Charges
description: When you directly use {Acid Flask} your Falcon has a chance to gain additional {Acid Flask} charges.
reminderText: If the chance goes above 100% it means there's a chance for an additional Acid Flask charge.

falc0-8.name: Falconer's Journey
description: Your Falcon deals more global damage per character level and per point of Dexterity (both multiplicative with other modifiers).

falc0-9.name: Is it a bird?
description:
Your Falcon deals more global damage (multiplicative with other modifiers). 

This effect is tripled for {Falcon Strikes}.

falc0-10.name: Watchful Eye
description: Your Falcon now more heavily prioritizes enemies close to you during combat.
reminderText: By default your Falcon, like other minions, takes proximity to its own position and to your position into account when deciding which enemies to target.

falc0-11.name: Sidekick
stats: Falcon Prioritizes close to Recent Target
description: Your Falcon now heavily prioritizes enemies close to the target location of your most recent melee, throwing or bow attack.
reminderText: By default your Falcon, like other minions, takes proximity to its own position and to your position into account when deciding which enemies to target.

falc0-12.name: Agile Prey
description:
Your Falcon deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

This effect is tripled against moving targets.

falc0-13.name: Dark Plumage
stats: 10% Black Arrow chance on Falcon Hit
description: When your Falcon hits an enemy it has a chance to drop a {Black Arrow} at its location.

falc0-14.name: Rending Talons
description: A portion of your chance to inflict bleed, poison, shred armor, shred resistances, and slow on hit now also apply to your Falcon's hits.

falc0-15.name: Feather Knives
description:
Your Falcon now uses {Feather Knives} at nearby enemies. This effect has a 10 second cooldown.

Your Falcon also throws a single Feather Knife whenever you consume {Falconer's Mark}.

falc0-16.name: Sky Chaser
stats: 75% Throwing Attack Speed -> Increased Cooldown Recovery Speed
description: A portion of your global throwing attack speed now applies to the Falcon's {Feather Knives} ability as increased cooldown recovery speed.

falc0-17.name: Trained to Hunt
description: A portion of the highest of your global increased melee damage, increased throwing damage, or increased bow damage now apply to all your Falcon's damage.

falc0-18.name: Go For the Eyes!
description: Your critical strike chance modifiers now also apply to your {Falcon}, but at a reduced ratio.

falc0-19.name: Exposed Weakness
stats: 25% Crit Multi -> Falcon Crit Multi Buff after Attack
description:
When you use a melee, throwing, or bow attack and critically strike at least one enemy, your Falcon gains a portion of your global melee, throwing, or bow critical strike multiplier respectively for 10 seconds.

This effect can occur at most twice every two second.

falc0-20.name: Side by Side
stats: -3% Remaining Cooldown Reduction after skill use
description: When you directly use a melee, throwing, or bow attack and hit at least one enemy, you reduce a portion of {Falcon Strike's} remaining cooldown.

falc0-21.name: Falcon Screech
description: After the first hit of {Falcon Strike} your Falcon lets out a {Screech} which slows and applies {Frailty} to enemies around it.

falc0-22.name: Frightful Feathers
stats: Falcon Screech on you at Low Health
description:
Your Falcon's {Screech} now also fears enemies it hits.

Additionally, your Falcon moves to you when a hit leaves you at low health, and this effect will interrupt any skill it is currently using.

This effect can occur at most every 10 seconds.

falc0-23.name: Avian Stamina
description: {Falcon Strikes} hits addtional times and your {Falcon} has increased melee attack speed.

falc0-24.name: Bird of Prey
description:
{Falcon Strikes} instantly kill enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health).

If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node then the highest threshold is used.

falc0-25.name: Razor Wings
description: {Falcon Strikes} now cause your Falcon to swoop down in a line in front of you attacking all enemies in that line rather than hitting enemies individually.

falc0-26.name: Wingspan
stats: +20% Falcon Strikes Damage after Area skill use
description:
A portion of your global increased area for area skills now applies to the width of {Falcon Strikes}.

Additionally, {Falcon Strikes} deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) if you have directly used an area skill in the past 8 seconds.

falc0-27.name: The Blood Dance
stats: +1 Additional Falcon Strikes hits on kill
+1 10% chance for Additional hits on Boss or Rares
description:
If {Falcon Strikes} kills an enemy it will hit an additional time.

Additionally, when {Falcon Strikes} hits a boss or rare enemy it has a chance to hit an additional time.

falc0-28.name: Hunter's Spoils
description: When your Falcon kills an enemy or hits a boss or rare enemy it restores health and mana to you based on your total attributes. This effect can occur from hits a limited number of times per 3 seconds.
reminderText: The effect is not limited for kills, and kills do not contribute to the hit effect limit.

falc0-29.name: Wake of Wings
description:
When you consume {Falconer's Mark} you gain the {Falcon's Wake} buff for a short duration. 

This buff grants you increased movement speed, attack and cast speed.

falc0-30.name: Falcon's Gale
description: Consuming a {Falconer's Mark} instantly recovers {Falcon Strike's} cooldown, but it now also costs additional mana.

flur3-0.name: Flurry
description: A bow or melee skill that performs 3 rapid attacks.

flur3-2.name: Alacrity
description: Flurry has increased attack speed.

flur3-3.name: Relentless
description: You have increased attack speed for each hit you dealt with your previous flurry, up to a maximum.
reminderText: Multiple stacks can be gained with each strike if you hit multiple enemies.

flur3-4.name: Kineticism
stats: +10% Chance for Kinetic Burst on Kill
description: Enemies killed by Flurry have a chance to release a {Kinetic Burst} around the target, dealing physical damage.

flur3-5.name: Deep Strikes
description: Flurry deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifers).

flur3-6.name: Blood Revelry
description: Flurry leeches a portion of the damage it deals as health.

flur3-7.name: Adrenaline Rush
description: Flurry strikes have a chance to grant you {Adrenaline Rush}, granting Flurry 5% more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and 5% increased attack speed. This lasts for 4 seconds, can stack up to 4 times.

flur3-8.name: Bloodplay
description: Each stack of {Adrenaline Rush} grants a chance to inflict bleed on hit.

flur3-9.name: Giant Slayer
stats: 15% More Damage to Bosses per Stack
description: Eack stack of {Adrenaline Rush} grants Flurry more hit damage against bosses and rare enemies.

flur3-10.name: Inexhaustible
description: {Adrenaline Rush} lasts longer.

flur3-11.name: Strained Reflexes
description: {Adrenaline Rush} can have multiple stacks.

flur3-12.name: Lethal Vector
description: Damaging ailments inflicted by Flurry deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

flur3-13.name: Boundless Blows
description: Flurry is now a channelled ability that costs mana per second to maintain.

flur3-14.name: Accelerating Impact
description: Flurry deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) for each second channelled up to a maximum.

flur3-15.name: Pavise
description: You have additional physical and elemental resistances while channelling Flurry.

flur3-16.name: Arrow Storm
description: If you are using a bow you fire arrows faster, but they are less accurate.

flur3-17.name: Vile Tactics
stats: +20% Third Strike Poison Res Shred Chance
+20% Third Strike Physical Res Shred Chance
description:
Flurry's first strike has a chance to inflict poison.
Flurry's second strike has a chance to cause bleed.
Flurry's third strike has a chance to shred physical and poison resistance.
reminderText: These chances are not reduced by Flurry's penalty to ailment chances.

flur3-18.name: Reopened Wounds
description: Bleed inflicted by Flurry has additional Physical Penetration.

flur3-19.name: Compounding Toxin
description: Poison inflicted by Flurry has additional Poison Penetration.

flur3-20.name: Shockwave
description: If you are using a melee weapon Flurry now causes {Force Waves} to blast forward with each strike, dealing melee physical damage.

flur3-21.name: Billowing Waves
description: The {Force Waves} travel further.

flur3-22.name: Precision
description: Improves Flurry's base critical strike chance.

flur3-23.name: Incision
description: Flurry critical strikes deal more damage.

flur3-24.name: Stolen Endurance
description: Critical strikes restore health. The amount of health gained is increased by Dexterity.

flur3-25.name: Second Wind
description: Flurry grants health when hitting at least one enemy.

flur3-26.name: Sap Willpower
description: Flurry grants mana when hitting at least one enemy.

flur3-27.name: Hamstring
description: Flurry's third strike Slows enemies hit.

flur3-28.name: Crescendo
description: Flurry's first and second strike deal less damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but the third strike deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

flur3-29.name: Fusillade
description: If you are using a bow, every 6th arrow is replaced with {Multishot}.
reminderText:
For nodes that affect the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd arrow separately, this means that the 3rd arrow of every second rotation is replaced with Multishot.

Multishot cast this way benefits from Multishot's skill tree, but not from Flurry's skill tree.

htsk5-1.name: Bloodseeker
description: You leech a portion of Heartseeker's damage and it has an additional chance to {Recurve}.

htsk5-2.name: Decimating Spike
description: Heartseeker has additional critical strike chance and its critical strikes deal more damage.

htsk5-3.name: Bonepiercer
description: Heartseeker deals more bow damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) after each recurve, up to a maximum.

htsk5-4.name: Exposed
description: Heartseeker's hits have a chance to apply frailty and shred enemy armor, but it no longer seeks new targets when the first target dies.

htsk5-5.name: Straight Through
description: When Heartseeker's target dies, you shoot {Puncture} at a nearby enemy for each {Recurve} it would have triggered after the target died.

htsk5-6.name: Hidden Skewer
description: Heartseeker has a chance on {Recurve} to grant you a {Dusk Shroud}, up to a maximum every 2 seconds.

htsk5-7.name: Gloom Needle
description: When you directly use Heartseeker and hit at least one enemy, it has a chance to consume one of your {Shadows} to use Heartseeker at the same target.

htsk5-8.name: Returning Darkness
description:
After a Heartseeker arrow {Recurves} at least 3 times, it has a chance to leave a {Black Arrow} between you and the target enemy if the enemy is at least 6 meters away.

This effect can occur a limited number of times every 3 seconds.

htsk5-9.name: Against All Odds
description: Heartseeker's hits cannot be dodged and it deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

htsk5-10.name: Controlled Icicle
description:
Heartseeker's base physical damage is converted to cold and it now has a base freeze rate. Consequently this damage scales with increases to cold damage, but not increases to physical damage.

Bleed chance on hit from all sources is converted to frostbite chance for Heartseeker.

Swaps Heartseeker's {Physical} tag for a {Cold} tag.
reminderText: This has no effect if you have taken the fire conversion node.

htsk5-11.name: Icy Impaler
description: Heartseeker's hits have a higher chance to freeze and have a chance to chill enemies.

htsk5-12.name: Frozen Splinter
stats: +1% Cold Penetration Per 10% Overcapped Cold Res
description: Heartseeker penetrate additional cold resistance scaling with your cold overcapped resistance.

htsk5-13.name: Molten Arrowstorm
description:
Heartseeker's base physical damage is converted to fire. Consequently this damage scales with increases to fire damage, but not increases to physical damage. 

Bleed chance from all sources is converted to ignite chance.

Swaps Heartseeker's {Physical} tag for a {Fire} tag.

htsk5-14.name: Blades of the Pyre
description: Heartseeker has a chance to grant you a {Burning Dagger} on {Recurve} consuming mana.

htsk5-15.name: Dragonfang
description: Consecutive {Recurves} each grant a stack of {Dragonfang} for 10 seconds. Higher stacks can only be achieved by a higher amount of consecutive {Recurves}, up to a maximum of 20.
reminderText: If Heartseeker {Recurves} twice, you will get two stacks. If the next Heartseeker {Recurves} three times, the first two stacks are refreshed and you will gain a third stack.

htsk5-16.name: Fury of the Hunt
description:
Directly using Heartseeker and hitting at least one enemy grants you frenzy for a short duration. 

This effect has a 10 second cooldown.

htsk5-17.name: Heartdrain
description: When directly used, Heartseeker arrows have a chance to grant mana and health on hit.

htsk5-18.name: Swift and Sure
description: Heartseeker has increased attack speed and costs less mana.

htsk5-19.name: Blightshot
description: Heartseeker's hits have a chance to poison enemies and poison it inflicts last longer.

htsk5-20.name: Heartrender
description: Heartseeker's hits have a chance to cause enemies to bleed and bleed it inflicts penetrate enemy physical resistance.

htsk5-21.name: Seeping Wounds
description: Heartseeker deals more ailment damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) after each recurve, up to a maximum.

htsk5-22.name: The Red Veil
description: Heartseeker has a chance to grant you {Crimson Shroud} on {Recurve}.

htsk5-23.name: Arrow Mastery
description: Heartseeker has an additional chance to {Recurve}.

htsk5-24.name: Arrow of the Ravager
description: Heartseeker has an additional chance to {Recurve}, and it deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but it now has a cooldown.

htsk5-25.name: Relentless Volley
description: Heartseeker has additional charges.

htsk5-26.name: Fletcher's Resurgence
description: Your Heartseeker restores a charge whenever you pick up a {Black Arrow}.

htsk5-27.name: Shadow Weaver's Grasp
description: Heartseeker now has a minimum chance to {Recurve}.
reminderText: Its {Recurve} chance can't be reduced below its minimum {Recurve} chance.

htsk5-28.name: Nimble Threads
description: Heartseeker has an additional chance to {Recurve} scaling with Dexterity.

htsk5-29.name: A Storm of Arrows
stats: +0.2 Hail of Arrows Duration On Recurve
description: Whenever Heartseeker {Recurves}, it extends the duration of your most recent {Hail of Arrows} by a small amount, up to 10 times per use of {Hail of Arrows}.

htsk5-30.name: Woven Grasp
description: Heartseeker now twists around in a semi-cirle to {Recurve} and its hits have a chance to slow enemies.
reminderText: The twisting and turning effect is only a visual change.

htsk5-31.name: Deep Rust
description: Armor shred chance from all sources is converted to poison chance.

mira59-0.name: Lethal Mirage
description: A circular attack that's also used by your shadow clones. Requires dual wielding.

mira59-2.name: Maj'elkan Blade
description: Lethal Mirage deals additional melee physical damage per equipped sword or dagger.

mira59-3.name: Wounding Ambush
description: Lethal Mirage penetrates enemy physical resistance.

mira59-4.name: Shocking Grasp
description:
Lethal Mirage deals additional melee lightning damage and its base physical damage is converted to Lightning. Consequently this damage scales with increases to lightning damage, but not increases to physical damage.

Physical penetration from this tree is converted to lightning penetration.

All bleed and poison chances are converted to shock chance.

Swaps Lethal Mirage's {Physical} tag for a {Lightning} tag.

mira59-6.name: Illusory Edge
description: Lethal Mirage has a chance to cause enemies to bleed, and bleed inflicted by Lethal Mirage has additional Physical Penetration.

mira59-7.name: Sundering Blows
description: Lethal Mirage hits deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per stack of bleed on the target up to a maximum.

mira59-8.name: Rive
description: Lethal Mirage has more critical strike chance (multiplicative with other modifiers) per stack of stack of bleed on the target.

mira59-9.name: Rending Darkness
description: Lethal Mirage can now also hit allies granting them the {Mirage Form} buff for 4 seconds, granting bleed chance and additional dodge rating.
reminderText: Your Mirages do not hurt allies.

mira59-10.name: Gloomy Friendship
description: Lethal Mirage now targets allies rather than enemies.

mira59-11.name: Phantasmal Presence
description: When Lethal Mirage ends you gain {Mirage Form} for 1 second per critical strike landed. This can stack up to 6 seconds.

mira59-12.name: Consuming Darkness
description: You gain health and mana per kill with Lethal Mirage.

mira59-14.name: Unending Mirage
description: Lethal Mirage gains an additional Mirage, resulting in more hits.

mira59-15.name: Gloom and Doom
description: Mirages have a chance to leave behind a {Shadow}.

mira59-17.name: Blur
description: Mirages are created faster, causing Lethal Mirage to have a shorter duration.

mira59-18.name: Synchronize
description: Reduce Lethal Mirage's cooldown per enemy killed by Lethal Mirage up to a maximum.

mira59-19.name: Ravaging Mirage
description: Lethal Mirage deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and leeches a portion of the melee damage dealt as health.

mira59-20.name: Shadow Eater
description: Lethal Mirage consumes all active {Shadows} gaining additional Mirages per {Shadow} consumed, resulting in more hits.

mira59-21.name: Umbral Feast
description: Lethal Mirage deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per {Shadow} consumed.

mira59-22.name: Umbral Burst
description: When you reappear Lethal Mirage releases a burst of smoke blinding enemies and inflicts them with {Frailty}.

mira59-23.name: Smoke Cloud
description: The smoke from {Umbral Burst} persists as a cloud blinding enemies and inflicting {Frailty} each second.

mira59-24.name: Feebling Shadows
description: Allies within the smoke cloud avoid critical strikes.

mira59-25.name: Umbral Toxins
description: The smoke cloud is converted to a poison cloud causing enemies to be poisoned each second, but no longer inflicts {Frailty}.

mira59-26.name: Lingering Sickness
description: Poisons caused by Lethal Mirage last longer.
reminderText: This includes poison stacks from the poison cloud.

mira59-27.name: Umbral Traversal
description: You gain {Haste} when you reappear.

mira59-28.name: Umbral Expanse
description: Lethal Mirage gains an additional Mirage, resulting in more hits.

mira59-29.name: A Gloomy End
description: Mirages have a chance to use {Shadow Cascade} in addition to their normal attack.

mira59-30.name: Pact of the Desert
description:
Lethal Mirage creates a {Shadow} at the location you disappear from.

This {Shadow} is not consumed by the {Shadow Eater} node.
reminderText:
Shadows will repeat one skill you use before vanishing. Shadows can repeat Acid Flask, Shurikens or Shadow Cascade, and their damage scales with your damage stats. 

You can have 3 Shadows at once, and they will disappear after 5 seconds.

mira59-31.name: Without a Trace
description:
Lethal Mirage instantly kills enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health), but can no longer inflict bleed.

If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node then the highest threshold is used.

mira59-32.name: Backstab
description: Improves Lethal Mirage's base critical strike chance, but it has fewer Mirages, resulting in fewer hits.

mush9-1.name: Efficient Draw
description: Multishot costs less mana.

mush9-2.name: Strong Pull
description: Multishot deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) when used directly, but has less attack speed (multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: This effect still applies to double shots from the {Back to Back} if the Multishot that triggered it was a direct use.

mush9-3.name: Bodkin Points
description: Multishot hits have a chance to apply armor shred on hit.

mush9-4.name: Readied Arrows
description: Multishot has a chance to be shot when you use another bow attack with increased chance to stun, but it costs significantly more mana.

mush9-5.name: Hang Loose
description: Multishot has increased attack speed and chance to gain {Haste} when you use or trigger Multishot from another skill.

mush9-6.name: Point Blank
stats: -25% Less Hit Damage To Far Away Targets
description: Multishot deals more hit damage to close targets (multiplicative with other modifiers) falling off rapidly, but deals less hit damage to far away targets (multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: It loses damage steadily as it travels, falling to its maximum damage loss at 22 units (the base distance Multishot arrows travel).

mush9-7.name: Back to Back
description: When directly using Multishot, every 6th attack is a double shot.

mush9-8.name: Repeater Bow
description:
Reduce the amount of attacks to double shoot with Multishot.

Additionally, Multishot deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

mush9-9.name: Quick Draw
description: Multishot has increased attack speed.

mush9-10.name: Piercing Shots
description: Multishot arrows pierce enemies (continue through enemies hit) up to a limit.

mush9-11.name: Critical Arrows
description: Multishot's critical strikes deal more damage.

mush9-12.name: Stand My Ground
description: Multishot deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) if you haven't moved in the past second.

mush9-13.name: Hit 'n' Run
description: You have a chance to gain {Haste} for 2 seconds when you use Multishot while {Stand My Ground} is activate.

mush9-14.name: True Strikes
description: Multishot has increased critical strike chance.

mush9-15.name: Large Quiver
description: Multishot has additional arrows, but costs more mana.

mush9-16.name: Heavy Arrows
stats: +10% Armor Shred Chance Per Arrow Before Limit
description:
Multishot deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but hits in a smaller cone and can only shoot a maximum of 3 arrows.

Additionally, Multishot hits have a chance to shred enemy armor per arrow before the limit.
reminderText:
Modifiers that grant benefits per arrow apply before the limit of this node.

For example if your Multishot would have 9 total arrows, this node will grant 90% armor shred chance even if you only shoot 3 arrows.

mush9-17.name: Toxic Gift
description: Multishot hits have a chance to inflict poison.

mush9-18.name: Rain of Arrows
description: Multishot hits in a wider cone.

mush9-19.name: No Easy Way Out
description: Multishot hits have a chance to slow and inflict bleed on enemies.

mush9-20.name: Pinning Shots
description: Multishot deals more hit damage to slowed targets (multiplicative with other modifiers).

mush9-21.name: The Maj'elkan Grasp
description: Multishot has increased slow and bleed duration per point of Dexterity.

mush9-22.name: Pincushion
description: Multishot penetrates enemy physical resistance.

mush9-23.name: Keep Pushing 'em Around
description:
Multishot hits have a chance to knock enemies on hit.

This effect only works on direct uses and has a 2 second cooldown.

mush9-24.name: Won't Back Down
description: When you are out of mana Multishot is free to use, but it can't shoot more than a few arrows. Other bonuses still apply.

mush9-26.name: Sniping
description: Multishot deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and arrows travel faster.

mush9-28.name: Giant Slayer
stats: Projectiles Can Hit The Same Target
description: Multishot arrows from the same attack can hit the same target and have an increased chance to stun enemies, but {Multishot} deals significantly less damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ne01t-2.name: Rending Wires
description: Net's hits have a chance to cause enemies to bleed.

ne01t-3.name: Advanced Engineering
description: Net snares enemies in a larger area.

ne01t-4.name: Surprise Snare
description: Net's hits cannot be dodged.

ne01t-5.name: Tanglewire
description: Net's hits slows enemies.

ne01t-6.name: Tangled and Prone
description: Netted enemies and enemies slowed by the {Tanglewire} node cannot dodge and cannot avoid critical strikes.
reminderText: This overrides enemies' chance to dodge or avoid crits.

ne01t-7.name: Leading the Hunt
description: Using Net grants you the {Huntress Advantage} buff for a short duration, granting you more global damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) against slowed or immobilized enemies.

ne01t-8.name: Quick Throws
description: While you have {Huntress Advantage} you now also have global increased throwing attack speed.

ne01t-9.name: Barbed Net
description: Net causes enemies to take physical damage over time and causes them to bleed each second.

ne01t-10.name: Voltaic Device
description:
Net's base physical damage is converted to lightning. Consequently this damage scales with increases to lightning damage, but not increases to physical damage.

Bleed chance on hit from all sources is converted to lightning resistance shred for Net.

Additionally, Net deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per global shock chance.

Swaps Net's {Physical} tag for a {Lightning} tag.

ne01t-11.name: Trapper's Crescendo
description: Net deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) scaling with your dodge chance.

ne01t-12.name: Curved Hooks
description: Net deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and bleeds that it inflicts last longer.

ne01t-13.name: Acid Snare
description:
Net's base physical damage is converted to poison. Consequently this damage scales with increases to poison damage, but not increases to physical damage.

Bleed chance on hit from all sources is converted to poison chance for Net.

Net gains the {Poison} tag.

ne01t-14.name: Bold Throw
description: You no longer flip back when using Net.

ne01t-15.name: Net Trap
description:
Net now throws a trap that releases a net at a nearby enemy when it triggers.

You can have a maximum of 6 Net Traps active at once and they last up to 30 seconds.
reminderText: If you reach your maximum number of active traps, throwing additional traps will destroy the oldest traps without detonating them.

ne01t-16.name: Spear Trap
description:
Net Traps now also use {Puncture} for you when they are triggered. This will use the melee or bow version of Puncture depending on your equipped weapon.

This consumes mana equal to a portion of {Puncture's} mana cost.
reminderText: If Puncture has no mana cost this effect would still cost 0 mana. 115% of 0 is still 0.

ne01t-17.name: Server of Tricks
description: You now throw additional Net traps with each throw, but Net costs additional mana.

ne01t-18.name: Trickster Artist
description: When using Net you drop {Caltrops} at your starting location after jumping.

ne01t-19.name: Zone of Control
description: {Caltrops} from all sources deal damage in a larger area.

ne01t-20.name: Silvered Spikes
stats: +1% Caltrops Crit Chance Per 10% Slow Chance
description: Improves {Caltrops'} base critical strike chance from all sources per 10% global slow chance.

ne01t-21.name: Tinkerer's Combo
description:
If Net hits an enemy you now also throw {Caltrops} at your target location where the Net hits.

This effect can occur once per 2 seconds.

ne01t-22.name: Agile Hunter
description: You jump further when using Net.

ne01t-23.name: Assault of the Huntress
description: You now jump forwards when using Net instead of backwards and it is thrown behind you.

ne01t-24.name: Into the Shadows
description: When directly using Net you now throw a {Smoke Bomb} after jumping.
reminderText: This effect only works if Smoke Bomb is off cooldown.

ne01t-25.name: Strongly Woven
description: Net snares enemies for a longer duration.

ne01t-26.name: Hunters of Heorot
stats: 3 Chill Stacks On Bosses And Rares
description:
Net's hits chill bosses and rare enemies while other enemies are stunned for a short duration. Additionally, you gain mana for each moving enemy hit.

This effect adds a 10 second cooldown.

ne01t-27.name: Engineering Smarts
description: Net has a shorter cooldown.

ne01t-28.name: Acrobatic
description:
You now jump further when using Net and it has a reduced cooldown.

Net gains the {Traversal} tag.

ne01t-29.name: Entangled Weapons
description: Netted enemies deal less physical damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ne01t-30.name: Exposed Bait
description: Your {Falcon} deals more global damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) to netted enemies.

ne01t-31.name: Weakening Threads
description: Net's hits apply frailty to enemies.

pun22-0.name: Puncture
description: An extended melee stab or piercing bow attack that causes enemies to bleed.

pun22-2.name: Perforate
description: Puncture has a chance to cause enemies to bleed.

pun22-3.name: Timing
description: Puncture deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but has less attack speed (multiplicative with other modifiers).

pun22-4.name: Stay of Execution
description:
Puncture can be charged up, causing Puncture with a melee weapon to deal damage in a larger area and causes Puncture with a bow to deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per second charged.

After 1 second it releases automatically.

pun22-5.name: Splinter
description: Puncture has a chance to shred enemy physical resistance.

pun22-6.name: Thrill of Anticipation
description: Puncture deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per second charged.

pun22-7.name: Press The Attack
description: Attacking with Puncture and hitting at least one enemy grants {Frenzy} for a short duration.

pun22-8.name: Efficacious Toxin
description: Puncture has a chance to apply {Efficacious Toxin} on hit, causing them to take increased damage over time.

pun22-9.name: Toxic Delivery
description: Puncture has a chance to poison on hit.

pun22-10.name: Penumbral Ambush
description: Directly using Puncture causes several {Mirages} to briefly appear at either side of you, attacking in the same direction as you.

pun22-11.name: Bloodthirst
description: Directly using Puncture and hitting at least one enemy grants you {Bleeding Fury}, a buff that grants bleed chance and stacks up to 3 times. Each stack falls off after 3 seconds of not attacking.
reminderText: Effects which specifically convert Puncture's ailment chance will also convert the ailment chance provided by this buff.

pun22-12.name: Hunger
description: {Bleeding Fury} can have more maximum stacks.

pun22-13.name: Shatter
description:
Puncture has a chance to shred enemy armor. 

Armor Shred applied by Puncture has increased effect.

pun22-14.name: Death's Imprint
description:
Puncture has a chance to apply a {Shadow Dagger} on hit.

This chance is doubled when you directly use Puncture.

pun22-15.name: Inescapable
description: Puncture deals more hit damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per stack of slow on the target.

pun22-16.name: Seized Prey
description: Puncture hits deal more damage against slowed and {Immobilized} targets (multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: {Immobilized} targets are unable to move for 1 second.

pun22-17.name: Scalebane
description:
Converts bleed chance from all sources to poison chance.
Converts physical resistance shred from all sources to poison resistance shred. Poison applied by Puncture has increased duration.

pun22-18.name: Mind Piercer
description: Directly using Puncture and hitting at least one enemy restores mana. Puncture also has physical penetration based on your maximum mana.
reminderText: Effects which specifically convert Puncture's ailment chance will also convert the penetration provided by this effect.

pun22-19.name: Cross Forward
description: When used with a melee weapon Puncture has increased range.

pun22-20.name: Redouble
description: When used with a bow, Puncture deals more hit damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per enemy pierced.

pun22-21.name: Debilitation
description: Puncture hits deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per unique negative ailment on the target.

pun22-22.name: Night's Descent
description: If you use Puncture with a bow while you have a {Black Arrow}, Puncture charges 100% faster and blinds on hit.
reminderText: If your maximum charge is 1 second, this will reduce the time it takes to reach maximum charge to 0.5 seconds, but you will still benefit as if you had charged for 1 second.

pun22-23.name: Sealed Fate
description: Every 10 seconds, your next Puncture {Immobilizes} enemies on hit, causing them to be unable to move for 1 second.

pun22-24.name: Cadence of Death
description: Every third Puncture deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), and if it is a melee attack it has increased area.

pun22-25.name: Sanguine Obsession
description:
Converts poison chance from all sources to bleed chance.

This has no effect if you have {Scalebane}.

pun22-26.name: Mutilate
description: Instead of applying bleed, the greater Puncture consumes all stacks of bleed on the target, causing them to deal damage immediately and restoring health per stack consumed.

pun22-28.name: Rapid Strikes
description: Every 4 seconds your first few direct uses of Puncture are rapid strikes, which have increased attack speed.
reminderText: The 4 second timer to reset your number of Rapid Strike starts after the first Rapid Strike.

shiif-0.name: Shift
description: Teleport a short fixed distance in the target direction.

shiif-2.name: Shadow Recuperation
description: Shifting heals you. The amount of health gained is increased by healing effectiveness.

shiif-3.name: Vault
description: You travel farther with Shift, but it has a longer cooldown.

shiif-4.name: Elusive
description: You have additional dodge chance per point of Dexterity for 1 second after Shifting.

shiif-5.name: Breathing Technique
description: Shifting heals you for a portion equal to your Dexterity. The amount of health gained is increased by healing effectiveness.

shiif-6.name: Molting
description: Shifting cleanses all negative ailments on you.

shiif-7.name: Rebound
description: If a single hit deals at least 50% of your health, Shift's cooldown is reset. This can only occur once every 10 seconds.

shiif-8.name: Deadly Ambush
description: You deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) with your next damaging non-channelled skill after Shifting.
reminderText: This damage modifier is additive with other damage modifiers on this tree, but multiplicative with other modifiers.

shiif-9.name: Momentum
description: You gain 50% increased movement speed for a brief moment after Shifting.

shiif-10.name: Hypovolemia
description: You have a chance to cause bleeding with your next damaging non-channelled skill after Shifting.

shiif-11.name: Jagged Cuts
description: After Shifting your next damaging non-channelled skill has increased bleed duration and bleed it inflicts has additional Physical Penetration.

shiif-12.name: Jade Quiver
notScalingStats: +60% Jade Arrow Increased Critical Strike Chance
description:
Using Shift grants you {Jade Arrows.} 

Using a bow attack consumes a {Jade Arrow} to have increased critical strike chance and a chance to poison enemies.

shiif-13.name: Jagged Arrows
description: Consuming a {Jade Arrow} also causes your next bow attack's critical strikes to deal more damage.

shiif-14.name: Venom Tipped Arrows
description: Consuming a {Jade Arrow} also grants your next bow attack increased damage over time.

shiif-15.name: Swift Recovery
description: Shift restores mana on use. This amount is tripled when below half health.

shiif-16.name: Shadowslip
description: You are invulnerable while Shifting.

shiif-17.name: Emergency Flask
description: Shift consumes a health potion on use if you are below 50% health.

shiif-18.name: Critical Opening
stats: Always Crit With Next Non-Channelled Skill
description: The next damaging non-channelled skill you use after Shifting is always a critical strike.

shiif-19.name: Unseen Strike
description: If using a melee weapon, when Shifting you perform an {Unseen Strike}, hitting enemies along your path.
reminderText: Deals melee physical damage, with 100% added damage effectiveness.

shiif-20.name: Sleight of Hand
description: You throw {Shurikens} at nearby enemies after Shifting.
reminderText: This will grant {Chakram} 10% more damage per point (multiplicative with other modifiers) if you have the {Keen Throw} node.

shiif-21.name: Broad Sweep
description: {Unseen Strike} hits in a wider area.

shiif-22.name: Lasting Presence
description: You leave behind a {Shadow} at the place you Shifted from.

shiif-23.name: Through the Shadows
description: When the {Shadow} created by Shift is consumed, you return to its location.

shiif-24.name: Dancing Shadows
description: After using Shift you use {Shadow Cascade}.

shiif-25.name: Arrival Gift
description: You have a chance to drop an {Acid Flask} on arrival.
reminderText: Acid Flask can not have extra projectiles when thrown from Shift.

shiif-26.name: Parting Gift
description: You have a chance to drop an {Acid Flask} on departure.
reminderText: Acid Flask can not have extra projectiles when thrown from Shift.

shiif-27.name: Velocity
description: Shift has a shorter cooldown and costs less mana.

shiif-28.name: Hidden Blades
description: {Unseen Strike} has a chance to inflict {Shadow Dagger} to enemies hit.

shiif-29.name: Low Blow
description: {Unseen Strike} slows enemies it hits.

shiif-30.name: Consumed by Shadow
description:
{Unseen Strike} instantly kills enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health).

If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node then the highest threshold is used.

shiif-32.name: Braskula's Hesitation
description: You deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) with your next damaging non-channelled skill after Shifting, but travel a shorter distance with Shift.
reminderText: This damage modifier is additive with other damage modifiers on this tree, but multiplicative with other modifiers.

smbmb-2.name: Thick Smoke
description: Applies slow to enemies within the smoke cloud each second.

smbmb-4.name: Eroding Fumes
description: Applies armor shred to enemies within the smoke cloud each second.

smbmb-5.name: Toxic Cloud
description: Armor shred applied by Smoke Bomb is converted to poison resistance shred.

smbmb-6.name: Venom Infusion
description: You have a chance to poison enemies with bow attacks while inside the smoke cloud.

smbmb-7.name: Smokescreen Arrow
description: While using a bow you now shoot an arrow that detonates the Smoke Bomb at the target location.

smbmb-8.name: Swirling Fog
description: Smoke Bomb has a chance to shred enemy armor each second within the smoke cloud.

smbmb-9.name: Knives in the Dark
description: Smoke Bomb has a chance to inflict a stack of {Shadow Dagger} whenever it applies slow.

smbmb-10.name: Lingering Fumes
description: The smoke cloud lasts longer.

smbmb-11.name: Shadow Hunter
description: Your bow attacks have improved base critcal strike chance and blind enemies while you are inside the smoke cloud.

smbmb-12.name: Smoke Blades
description: You and allies are granted {Smoke Blades} each second for 4 seconds while inside the smoke cloud, granting you additional melee and throwing damage. This effect can stack.

smbmb-13.name: Blood Bandit
description: {Smoke Blades} now also causes melee and throwing attacks to leech a portion of the damage you deal as health.

smbmb-14.name: Umbral Assault
description: The smoke cloud has a chance to create a {Shadow} each second at a random location inside the smoke cloud.

smbmb-15.name: Concealed in Carnage
stats: -5% Damage Over Time Taken per Crimson Shroud
description: You are granted a stack of {Crimson Shroud} on kill while inside the smoke cloud, granting you bleed chance and less damage over time taken for 4 seconds. This stacks up to 3 times.

smbmb-16.name: Cloaked Incursion
description:
You leap to the target location when you use Smoke Bomb, instead of backflipping away.

Smoke Bomb now has a much shorter cooldown, but counts as a {Traversal} skill.
reminderText: Using a Traversal skill puts all other traversal skills on cooldown and traversal skills' cooldowns do not recover while you are using a traversal skill.

smbmb-17.name: Generosity
description: The smoke cloud covers a larger area.
reminderText: This affects starting area and maximum area, but not how long it takes to reach maximum area.

smbmb-18.name: Escape Tactics
description:
You backflip away from target direction when you use Smoke Bomb. Smoke Bomb now counts as movement skill.

During Smoke Bomb's movement you are immune to Damage.

smbmb-19.name: Enfeeblement
description: The initial burst applies {Frailty} to enemies, causing them to deal less damage.

smbmb-20.name: Moonlight Bomb
description: The initial burst grants you a stack of {Silver Shroud}, causing you to dodge the next hit and gain ward per stack.

smbmb-21.name: Cleansing Steam
description: The initial burst cleanses negative ailments on you.

smbmb-22.name: Purging Fumes
description: The initial burst also cleanses negative ailments on allies.

smbmb-23.name: Invigorating Darkness
description: The initial burst consumes all {Shadows} inside the smoke to grant you and allies health per {Shadow} consumed this way.

smbmb-24.name: Refreshment
description: The initial burst consumes all {Shadows} inside the smoke to grant you and allies mana per {Shadow} consumed this way.

smbmb-25.name: Engulfed in Flames
description: The smoke cloud catches fire at the end of its duration, igniting enemies inside the cloud.

smbmb-26.name: Hasty Combustion
description: Leaving the smoke cloud early causes it to immediately catch fire and end.

smbmb-27.name: Cleaving Shadows
description: You use {Shadow Cascade} when the smoke cloud ends.

smbmb-28.name: Trapped Shadows
description: Your {Decoys} inside the smoke cloud automatically explode when the smoke cloud ends.

smbmb-29.name: Shrouded in Darkness
description: You are granted a stack of {Dusk Shroud} each second for 2 seconds while you are in the smoke cloud, granting you glancing blow chance and dodge rating. This effect can stack.

smbmb-30.name: Rapid Concealment
description: The smoke cloud grants stacks of {Dusk Shroud} more frequently.

smbmb-31.name: Shared Concealment
description: The smoke cloud now also grants {Dusk Shroud} to allies for 2 seconds while inside the smoke cloud.

smbmb-32.name: Impending Gloom
description: The smoke cloud has a larger area and grows faster.
reminderText: This affects starting area and maximum area, and reduces how long it takes to reach maximum area.

smbmb-34.name: Hidden Blows
description: {Puncture} and {Shurikens} have a chance cause enemies to bleed if used inside the smoke cloud.

srk21-2.name: Toxic Tips
description: Shurikens has a chance to poison enemies.

srk21-3.name: Weighted Projectiles
description: Shurikens penetrates enemy physical resistance.

srk21-4.name: Deep Cuts
description: Shurikens has a chance to cause enemies to bleed.

srk21-6.name: Flip of a Coin
description: You have a chance to throw many additional Shurikens with each throw.
reminderText: For calculating the damage bonus of the {Keen Throw} node this effect counts as if it always added 2 shurikens.

srk21-7.name: Entry Points
description: Shurikens hits deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per stack of bleed or poison on the target up to a maximum.

srk21-8.name: Throwing Star
description: Shurikens are now be thrown at enemies all around you rather than in a cone in front of you.

srk21-9.name: Scintillant Steel
description: Shurikens deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), and costs less mana.

srk21-10.name: Keen Throw
description: {Chakram} hits deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) for each projectile you would release with Shurikens.

srk21-11.name: Behind the Veil
description: Shurikens has a chance to {Blind} enemies.

srk21-12.name: Acrobatics
description: You backflip away from target direction when you use Shurikens, but it now has a cooldown.

srk21-13.name: Exuberance
description: Shurikens has a shorter cooldown and you gain {Haste} for a short duration if it hits at least one enemy.

srk21-14.name: Stagger
description: Shurikens {Immobilizes} enemies on hit, causing them to be unable to move for a short duration.

srk21-15.name: Alacrity
description: Shurikens has increased attack speed.

srk21-16.name: Charged Steel
description:
Shurikens deals additional lightning damage and a percentage of its base physical damage is converted to Lightning. Consequently this damage scales with increases to lightning damage, but not increases to physical damage.

Shurikens gains a {Lightning} tag. If all its base damage is converted it loses its {Physical} tag.
reminderText: Conversion above 100% has no effect

srk21-17.name: Shuriken Storm
description: Shurikens shocks enemies on hit.

srk21-18.name: Abrasive Arsenal
description: Shurikens has a chance to shred enemy physical and poison resistance.

srk21-19.name: Ricochet
description:
Shurikens ricochets to different targets up to a maximum number of times, but costs more mana.

Pierce chance is converted to additional critical strike multiplier.
reminderText: This does not enable Chakrams to ricochet.

srk21-20.name: Fan of Blades
description: You throw additional Shurikens with each throw.

srk21-21.name: Blade Shield
description: You now summon your Shurikens in a shield around you for 3 seconds. This effect does not stack.
reminderText: Granting Shurikens pierce, such as from {Ethereal Blades}, will not allow each Shuriken to hit an individual enemy more than once.

srk21-22.name: Bladed Armor
description: You have increased armor per Shuriken spinning around you.

srk21-23.name: Floating Blades
description: {Blade Shield} lasts longer.

srk21-24.name: Aerodynamic
description:
Shurikens travel faster and farther.

This does not affect {Chakram.}

srk21-25.name: Deadly Aim
description:
Shurikens are now thrown in a straight line and they can hit the same target, but you throw half as many (rounded up).

This has no effect if you have the {Blade Shield} node.

srk21-27.name: Ethereal Blades
description: Shurikens has a chance to pierce enemies (continue through targets they hit).

srk21-28.name: Jagged Edges
description: Improves Shurikens' base critical strike chance and Shurikens deals more hit damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

srk21-29.name: Massacre
description: Shurikens' critical strikes deal more damage.

srk21-30.name: Chakram
description:
You now throw a single returning {Chakram} instead of multiple Shurikens. 

The Chakram has increased size and deals significantly more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

sync5-0.name: Synchronized Strike
description:
Requires a melee weapon.

Jump forward and strike in an area in front of you while shadows appear and simultaneously strike on either side of you.

sync5-1.name: Growing Darkness
description: Synchronized Strike deals damage in a larger area.

sync5-2.name: Foreshadowing
description: {Shadows} created within 4 seconds of using Synchronized Strike deal increased damage.

sync5-3.name: Dark Allies
description: Synchronized Strike creates 2 additional {Shadows}, but costs significantly more mana. This can exceed your normal maximum number of {Shadows}.
reminderText: This effect is not cumulative with other sources of additional maximum {Shadows}.

sync5-4.name: Razor Strikes
description: Synchronized Strike has a chance to cause enemies to bleed and a chance to shred enemy physical resistance.

sync5-5.name: Crimson Storm
notScalingStats: -5% Damage Over Time Taken per Crimson Shroud
description: Using Synchronized Strike grants you {Crimson Shroud} for a short duration, granting you bleed chance and less damage over time taken. This stacks up to 3 times for a short duration.

sync5-6.name: Shadow Dancing
description: Synchronized Strike deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but {Shadows} from Synchronized Strike expire after attacking. They also do not cause existing {Shadows} to expire and do not trigger {on shadow creation} or {on shadow expiration} effects.

sync5-7.name: Shadow Fang
description: Synchronized Strike deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

sync5-8.name: Last Call
description: Synchronized Strike deals more damage to enemies on low health.
reminderText: Targets below 35% of max health are considered to be at low health.

sync5-9.name: Lust for Carnage
description: Synchronized Strike leeches a portion of the damage it deals as health.

sync5-10.name: Escape Artist
description: You gain {Haste} for a short duration when you kill an enemy with Synchronized Strike.

sync5-11.name: Umbral Execution
description:
Synchronized Strike instantly kills enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health).

If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node then the highest threshold is used.

sync5-12.name: Thrill of the Kill
description: You are granted increased critical strike chance for 4 seconds on kill with Synchronized Strike. This effect can stack.

sync5-13.name: Blade Prowess
description: Synchronized Strike deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per equipped sword and has a chance to poison enemies per equipped dagger.

sync5-14.name: Lethality
description: Improves Synchronized Strike's base critical strike chance.

sync5-15.name: True Strikes
description: Synchronized Strike deals more critical strike damage.

sync5-16.name: Harmony of Death
description: Synchronized Strike has a chance to inflict enemies with {Critical Vulnerability}.

sync5-17.name: Coordinated Cuts
description: Synchronized Strike has a chance to shred enemy armor. Armor shred applied by Synchronized Strike has increased effectiveness.

sync5-18.name: Umbral Assassination
description: Synchronized Strike inflicts enemies with a {Shadow Dagger}.

sync5-19.name: Shadow Infusion
description: Synchronized Strike consumes existing {Shadows} to deal damage in a larger area and grant you ward per {Shadow} consumed.

sync5-20.name: Wave of Darkness
description:
Synchronized Strike causes existing {Shadows} to use {Shadow Cascade} on use, rather than being consumed immediately. 

This effect consumes a portion of mana per active Shadow.

sync5-21.name: Dynamics
description: Synchronized Strike costs less mana.

sync5-22.name: Art of the Blade
description: You are granted increased attack speed for 3 seconds if Synchronized Strike hits at least one enemy.

sync5-23.name: Perfect Coordination
description: The {Shadows} now jump inward towards the target rather than outward, but Synchronized Strike costs more mana.

sync5-24.name: Divergence
description: Synchronized Strike deals more damage, but the {Shadows} now attack from where you teleport from, rather than where you arrive.

sync5-25.name: Shadow Rush
description: {Shadows} created within 4 seconds of using Synchronized Strike restore health on creation.

sync5-26.name: Retreat Into Shadow
description: You now disappear instead of teleporting to the target and a {Shadow} is created in your place, but Synchronized Strike has a longer cooldown.

sync5-27.name: Dark Passage
description: Synchronized Strike deals significantly more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but will no longer generate any {Shadows} other than the one created by {Dark Passage}.

sync5-28.name: Cutthroat
description: Synchronized Strike always critically hits enemies on high health.
reminderText: Targets above 65% max health are considered to be at high health.

ub5d9-1.name: Dawnfall
description: You have a chance to gain {Dusk Shroud} when you use Umbral Blades and hit at least one enemy.

ub5d9-2.name: Sword Thrower
description: You now throw just one large Umbral Blade with each throw that deals significantly more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and has increased radius.
reminderText: For subskills that scale with area such as {Bladestorm} and {Blade Explosion} the effect of this node's radius increase on the skills' area is additive with sources of increased area.

ub5d9-3.name: Cacophony of Steel
description:
Blades in the ground now create a {Bladestorm} that hovers and spins in midair at the target location for 4 seconds, hitting nearby enemies 3 times per second.

You can have up to 3 active Bladestorms, but each enemy can only take damage from one at a time.

Bladestorms have 40% less chance to inflict {Shadow Daggers} from {Lethal Darkness}.
reminderText: Attack speed modifiers do not affect the rate at which Blade Storms hit enemies.

ub5d9-4.name: Steel Torrent
description: {Bladestorms} last longer and deal damage in a larger area.

ub5d9-5.name: Loathing
description: {Bladestorms} slowly seek out enemies.

ub5d9-6.name: Lethal Darkness
description: Umbral Blades hits inflict a stack of {Shadow Dagger} on hit, while using a dagger.
reminderText: This is not affected by Umbral Blades' reduction to ailment application chance.

ub5d9-7.name: Edge of Obscurity
stats: +2% Damage per Dusk Shroud, up to 20
description:
Umbral Blades deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per stack of {Dusk Shroud} on you, up to 20. 

This effect is doubled while inside the area of {Smoke Bomb}.

ub5d9-8.name: Umbral Remnant
description: Whenever one of your {Shadows} expire they now also leave behind an Umbral Blade.
reminderText: {Shadows} using Umbral Blades always throw a single Shadow Blade that deals 300% more damage.

ub5d9-10.name: Soul Thief
stats: +4 Ward Gain On Hit On Recall
description: Umbral Blades has increased attack speed and you gain ward on hit with recalled blades.

ub5d9-11.name: Stabbing Blast
description: Recalling the blades now sends each blade toward a different nearby enemy instead of to you, but recalled blades no longer pierce.
reminderText: If there are fewer enemies than blades, the remaining blades will go in random directions.

ub5d9-12.name: Shredding Daggers
description: Recalled blades now have a chance to pierce enemies (pass through enemies it hits).

ub5d9-13.name: Nightmare Dash
description:
You can now only recall blades by using {Shift}, rather than the combo itself.

You regain mana for each blade recalled.

ub5d9-14.name: Backstab
description: Recalled blades deal more damage, but blades thrown out deal less damage (both multiplicative with other modifiers).

ub5d9-15.name: Slice the Legs
description: Recalled blade hits have a chance to slow enemies and a chance to cause them to bleed.
reminderText: These chances are not affected by Umbral Blades' reduction to ailment application chance.

ub5d9-16.name: Bloody Trail
stats: +10% Recalled Blades Hit Damage Per Slow
+3% Recalled Blades Hit Damage Per Bleed
description: Recalled blade hits deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) per stack of slow on the target and per bleed on the target, up to a maximum.

ub5d9-17.name: Cut and Leave
description:
Umbral Blades hits have a chance to cause enemies to bleed. 

When your blades are recalled you have a chance to gain {Haste} for 1 second.
reminderText: This bleed chance is not affected by Umbral Blades' reduction to ailment application chance.

ub5d9-18.name: Emerald Cutlass
description:
Converts bleed chance from all sources to poison chance for Umbral Blades and effects related to bleed now depend on poison instead. 

If you have the {Explosive Blades}, the explosion hit poisons enemies, but deals 80% less damage and it no longer deals any fire damage.

ub5d9-19.name: Kunai Belt
description: You now throw additional blades with Umbral Blades on the second throw.

ub5d9-20.name: Hidden Blades
notScalingStats: +1 Extra Blades On Next Throw Every 2 Seconds
description: Every 2 seconds you throw additional blades with Umbral Blades on the next throw.

ub5d9-21.name: Jagged Carvings
description: Umbral Blades deals additional throwing physical damage.

ub5d9-22.name: Twilight Assault
description: You now throw a third time with Umbral Blades with 4 blades before recalling the blades.

ub5d9-23.name: Duskhunter
description: You now throw additional blades with Umbral Blades on the third throw.

ub5d9-24.name: Subzero Intrusion
description:
Umbral Blades base physical damage is converted to cold. Consequently this damage scales with increases to cold damage, but not increases to physical damage. It also has a chance to freeze enemies.

Swaps Umbral Blades' {Physical} tag for a {Cold} tag.

ub5d9-25.name: Coldsnap Strike
description: Umbral Blades hits have additional freeze rate and have a chance to chill enemies.
reminderText: This chill chance is not affected by Umbral Blades' reduction to ailment application chance.

ub5d9-26.name: Precision Cuts
description: Umbral Blades now stop if they reach the target location, and you have increased attack speed with Umbral Blades.

ub5d9-27.name: Explosive Blades
description:
Blades in the ground now arm after 0.5 seconds, but can no longer be recalled and Umbral Blades has less attack speed (multiplicative with other modifiers). If enemies walk over them the blades will cause a {Shard Explosion}, a subskill dealing physical and fire damage in an area.

Blades expire and explode after 3 seconds if no enemies walk over them.

ub5d9-28.name: Burst of Agony
stats: +20% More Explosion Area Per Second On Ground
+20% Explosion Damage Per Second On Ground
description: The {Shard Explosion} deals damage in a larger area and deals more damage per second the blade has remained on the ground (both multiplicative with other modifiers).
